alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 2:03PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cumberland County through 245 PM CDT... At 202 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crossville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Fairfield Glade, Crab Orchard, Cumberland Mountain State Park, Slate Springs and Lake Tansi. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 315 and 327. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
